com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter.elm327

Class ELM327.DefaultResponseListener<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter.elm327.ELM327.DefaultResponseListener<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data that shall be unmarshalled from the response
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseListener<java.lang.String>
    Enclosing class:
    ELM327

    private static final class ELM327.DefaultResponseListener<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResponseListener<java.lang.String>
    The ResponseListener that handles incoming responses from the ELM327 board. The ELM327 responds differently to different types of Requests:
    • ConfigurationRequest - An implementation defined value is sent from the ELM327, generally the string 'OK' upon success. This value is passed to the provided Handler verbatim
    • ServiceRequest - The first two characters sent from the ELM327 is "40" plus the service ID; thus a request using service ID 1 (Service.LIVE_DATASTREAM) shall produce "41". The following two characters are the PID/TID/OBDMID/INFOTYPE ID of the request; so PID #1 (AppendixB.MONITOR_STATUS) shall produce "01". The following characters sequence is the actual data response from the ELM327. So to sum everything up, a service request $02$04 would produce the following response: "4204??" where "??" is a single hex-byte representing the calculated engine load. This ResponseListener trims off the first four characters of each response, invoking the requested PID.Unmarshaller
      • on only the actual data.
